intro: Gutzlaffia lyi, commonly known as the Bolivian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that rises above the foliage. Gutzlaffia lyi is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
